Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2012 07:37PM Kellygrl77 wrote: I have had to stay on chemo &prayer I admit I was a picky eater before. Now tastes have changed drastically & food doesn't stay with me well. I loose weight for couple weeks (I tell my nurses that say they don't want you to loose weight like that that I do have plenty to spare than gain it back &trying then some but still really can't eat or make it stay) I did ok with baked potatoes for lil while. Don't care for sweets but a good chocolate malt helped when really bad than sometimes ensure (thought slim fast would have been better lol). Oily greasy foods are definatly out. Has been suggested to avoid metal utensils to avoid metal tastes & try ginger for nausea. A lot of things to me now taste like metal, grease, sour or bad or cause bad nausea heartburn etc.
Posts.Title: Chemo tastebuds breakthrough for me Angela-R Kellygrl77

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2014 03:53AM Kellygrl77 wrote: The ALS ice bucket challenge has done really well & brought a lot more awareness & is starting to get old for some.  Breast cancer is one of the more public popularity cancers with turning everything pink, October, Komen Race For a Cure & many others.  To those it's creating something different & making it stick around.  Once you do the ice bucket challenge do they do it again or repeatedly.  Unfortunately dare I say it (sorry things just pop in my head).  Best attention I can think of is "Flash for a bc cure" or "or flash for cash for bc" you peaked you pay you flash.  Would definitely get the attention of about everyone good & bad for sure.  But first off I couldn't do it, second just I bit inappropriate lol.  hmmm I do kinda have an idea that might clean it up for everyone.  Maybe at the top write that then in the video flash a sign saying "pay up & flash" tell them "you got flashed now pay up donate to bc & you gotta flash within 24hrs.  Show your pay up & flash sign".  Maybe kinda cheesy but wouldn't have to nominate or maybe tag some people as well say (whatever 3 as well) you have been flashed so you flash & pay as well donate to bc.  I don't know.  But anything like that can only go around for so long.  I've just seen a lot of people change the als to the pms challenge where they chug a beer in respect of those suffering its side effects from the women in their life.

Posts.Content: Kellygrl77 wrote: I know we all are told never stopping herceptin.  That is what I was told as well but have actually stopped and really would like to know if there is anyone else out there with stage 4 that have also?  I was on herceptin & perjeta about to change out  perjeta to tdm1 when I had become to sick with an infection & had to stop with last treatment of herceptin & perjeta in June 2013.  There was always an urgency as soon as the infection was gone to start it back up asap.  Since the scans stayed clear I am now remaining off of all treatmests.  After a good Pet scan we were to do another biopsy of a spot to just make sure it was still clear but have only done another cat scan that was at the end of March last month & haven't heard anything else since about the cat scan or the biopsy, guess no news is good news.  Is there anyone else that is stage 4 her2 positive and has stopped treatments?  I'm happy but still scared of if or when it comes back if it really is possible to stay off?  Just really like to know if there's other's out there that have stopped & remained off?  Don't even know how often to follow up.   Dx 3/2012, 5cm, Stage IV, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 3/4/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 3/4/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Surgery Lumpectomy: Left Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: NED her2+ & stopped herceptin Kellygrl77 suzanneleempoels

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2012 12:04AM Kellygrl77 wrote: I went bald this summer a lot or a hat here & there. I tried putting on the wig but was too hot humid & itchy. The first time I went out bald was kinda funny. My mom was out visiting & she rushed me out the door. We were laughing & talking than I reached up rubbed my head & gasped. I forgot my hat, I'm completely bald. Well I was just laughing & smiling & had only just noticed so why not just continue & just enjoy the day. Then something else kinda funny. Now days with people shaving thier heads just because, crazy colors, crazt styles you can just about blend right in. I met one woman & she said wow what made me decide to shave my head. I didn't know what to say "ummm cancer". She felt terrible, but we both laughed. So many women have just shaved their head just because. I have gotten used to seeing it as incredible strength. Always loved the movie gi jane. Did always have super long hair & somedays are hard, was even worse looking in the mirror seeing no eyebrows or eyelashes & couldn't put on makeup without being able to put on mascara which was even harder. It is slowly coming back & now just trying to keep my head warm. I think a bald head with a beautiful smile shows true strength more than an ugly sickness. Still have the wigs on standby for an occasion I can't go without. So far so good.
